develops a whole range of different

launched is of course on bias mitigation
and fairness criteria so in that course
we really take students and teach them
Hands-On applications or coding examples
and a theory on how to identify bias in
machine learning and eventually also how
to measure and mitigate as much bias as
possible there's obviously a lot of
research and literature out there about
fairness and bias mitigation in machine
learning but then really taking that
research and bringing it to the people
who actually implement this on a daily
basis was the key goal in developing
this course and now actually seeing the
students come in and using these
learnings and implementing them has been
very excited when I was studying we're

learning gone wrong and I found that the
one common thing that these examples had
